title: Understanding Delusions
text: Delusions are a common symptom in various mental health disorders, including schizophrenia. They involve beliefs that are not based in reality.

title: Characteristics of Delusions
text: Delusions are often resistant to contrary evidence. Even when presented with facts, individuals with delusions may not change their beliefs.

hintAnswer: a fixed false belief that cannot be changed in the mind of those who hold them despite evidence to the contrary
title: Identifying Delusions
text: Which of the following best describes a delusion?
choices: a fixed false belief that cannot be changed in the mind of those who hold them despite evidence to the contrary
fixed false beliefs with content that is not reasonably possible in this world. They are strange, eccentric, and unrealistic
a fixed false belief containing content that is plausible but inconsistent with evidence
the perception of sensory experiences without natural external stimuli
